text: Enjoyed on tap at Bells Brewery in Kalamazoo, MI back in February, rating it now because Im bored. I gave it a 4.75/5 on Untappd, but no notes, so I guess it was really good, but I cant remember having this, so Ill take my own word for it.

On tap: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy roasted coffee, light-moderate chocolate, and a touch of cream. Its a dark brown with some faint orange highlights. It has a small beige head that fades to a minimal film outlined by thicker ring. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate. The finish has moderate coffee with some light vanilla, cream, and a touch of roasted nuts. Its medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation and soft mouthfeel.

Tap at Clubhouse BFD. Pours black, big tan head. Aroma is lots of coffee. Super roasted. Some lactose, sure, but that coffee pops. Flavor is robust bitter coffee, mouthfeel and sweetness balance it out with that lactose. Yea it goes bitter coffee, really nice sweet milk chocolate, then a little more coffee bitter finish. Really nice. Well done. I expect no less from a Bells Stout.

On tap at Petes Place. Big dark pour with a thick frothy dark head. Left with an oily look. Big coffee bean nose. Big coffee flavor with a milk chocolate finish. Sugary taste. Good light stout though.
On tap at Crunchy's. Very dark. Off white lacing. Coffee and chocolate aroma. Smooth feel with lingering taste.
On tap at Beer Culture. Dark brown body with medium head. Nose is coffee, chocolate and malts. Taste also of coffee, malts, spices and chocolate. Nice balance. Light in the finish.

Draft at Fishale. Dark brown pour with a khaki ring. The aroma is dark roasted coffee and tobacco. The flavor is earthy, fresh ground coffee. Maybe some chocolate in the lingering finish. Pretty light and refreshing for a coffee ale.

Draught at High Dive, Brooklyn, NYC. Opaque black beer with a nice beige head. Fruity caramel aroma, chocolate, coffee, cream notes, figs, some cocoa powder. Roasted chocolate and coffee aroma, tobacco, soot, cream, grapes, cocoa powder. Well balanced stout.
Is fairly creamy and has a very cocoa and coffee flavor. Wouldnt drink to many but is excellent.
Tap at Busters for rating 9,000. Very dark dense pour with a dense coating head. Wonderful coffee and lactose all over this. Creamy palate. Full flavored and easy drinking. Excellent brew.
Tap. Pours a super dark brown with tan head. Aroma and taste of lots of coffee, roasted malts. Very intense on the coffee. Tasty.

On draught at House Wine. The beer pours brown-black with a medium foamy beige head that diminishes gradually to a film. Sticky small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted coffee, malt and chocolate. Light to medium body with a roasty coffee and malt character, with some chocolate in the background. The finish is creamy with a mocha aftertaste. Good beer all around.
Draught at Hop Cat. Lactose sugar creamer and some big ass coffee notes. Dark body. Excellent.
Keg at Beer Run. Dark brown, large creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of strong coffee, chocolate and vanilla. The taste is the same. Medium bodied, creamy.
Tasting at Hackneys Printers Row. Pure dark roasted coffee beans. Not much else. Delicious.

Pour on tap at the brewery, dark brownish black pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of cocoa, roast, some slight coffee, lactose notes with a hint of vanilla. Taste was a mix of roast, coffee, milk chocolate, slight spice notes, finishing fairly dry, slightly sweet.

Draft to snifter at Cappys pour opaque black with moderate tan head. Nose nice roast malt, coffee, lactose. Taste similar to nose with more lactose and milky mouth feel. Light chocolate, good roasted coffee.

On tap at Studio 35 at the Dude-a-Thon on 1/17/16. Pours darkest brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of coffee, sweet cream, chocolate and roast. Malty and chocolatey flavor with lots of coffee roast and bitterness before a sweet cream finish.

Growler from Stout Bros in Smyrna. Surprised to see this one on the board. Black pour with a frothy beige head. Big time coffee forward aroma with hints of roast, vanilla, milk sugar. Flavors were slightly sweet with lots of coffee, slight hints of roasted malt. Lingering sweet cocoa flavors, slick mouthfeel. Good stuff.

On tap at Bells All Stouts Day. The pour is a medium black with some garnet notes shining through and a thick tan head that falls to a film, leaving some great lace. The aroma is strong on lactose. There is a good milky undertone and a ton of lactose. There is a touch of coffee but for the more part it's dominated by roast and lactose. The flavor is full of lactose sweetness. There is a light roast and some good coffee in it, but the lactose takes center stage the mouth feel is thin and watery, but the carbonation helps it thicken up a bit. The aftertaste is lingeringly roasty with tons of coffee and a solid milky sweetness. Not too shabby

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is coffee and lactose, roasted malt, chocolate, very very nice. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head. Taste is lactose, coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, real nice. Mouthfeel is a touch thin, medium carbonation and body. Overall, a fine offering.

Draft to taster at the Eccentric Cafe. Looks good; a slightly translucent dark cola with thin beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; dark malt, coffe roast, and chocolate. Tastes like it smells with a medium-bodied mouthfeel. Enjoyable, and Id love to see it reproduced as an imperial.
